TypeSignature.Value: public delegate void KeyboardEventHandler(object sender, KeyboardEventArgs e);
.class public auto ansi sealed KeyboardEventHandler extends System.MulticastDelegate
Public Delegate Sub KeyboardEventHandler(sender As Object, e As KeyboardEventArgs)
public delegate void KeyboardEventHandler(System::Object ^ sender, KeyboardEventArgs ^ e);
type KeyboardEventHandler = delegate of obj * KeyboardEventArgs -> unit

Docs.param: O objeto em que o manipulador de eventos está anexado.
Docs.summary: Representa o método que manipulará eventos roteados relacionados ao teclado.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Nenhum evento de teclado existente no [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winclient](~/includes/tla2sharptla-winclient-md.md)] usa o <xref:System.Windows.Input.KeyboardEventHandler> delegar. <xref:System.Windows.Input.KeyboardEventHandler> usa o <xref:System.Windows.Input.KeyboardEventArgs> classe como sua classe de dados de evento de base. <xref:System.Windows.Input.KeyboardEventArgs> serve como a classe base para o mais específico <xref:System.Windows.Input.KeyEventArgs> e <xref:System.Windows.Input.KeyboardFocusChangedEventArgs> classes de dados do evento. Essas classes de dados de evento são usados pela <xref:System.Windows.Input.KeyEventHandler> e <xref:System.Windows.Input.KeyboardFocusChangedEventHandler> delegados e esses delegados são usados por existirem [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winclient](~/includes/tla2sharptla-winclient-md.md)] eventos, como <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.KeyDown?displayProperty=nameWithType> e <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.LostKeyboardFocus?displayProperty=nameWithType>.
